meanings.definition: To act in an exaggerated or theatrical manner.
meanings.sent1: During the play, Sarah hammed up her role as the wicked witch.
meanings.sent2: The actor always hams it up on stage to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent3: At the party, John hammed up his dance moves, pretending to be a famous pop star.
meanings.sent4: The comedian hammed up his jokes, making everyone in the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent5: She hammed up her surprise when she saw the birthday cake, pretending not to know about the party.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with force.
meanings.sent1: The boxer hammed his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally hammed his thumb with the hammer while fixing the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The baseball player hammed the ball out of the park, scoring a home run.
meanings.sent4: The storm hammed the coast, causing massive destruction.
meanings.sent5: She hammed the table in frustration, making all the dishes rattle.

meanings.definition: To preserve meat by salting and smoking.

meanings.sent2: In the olden days, people would ham meat to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: Grandma always hams the turkey for Thanksgiving dinner, following a family tradition.
